name: The Whitmore Estate Murders
preview: Three impossible murders at a fog-shrouded estate reveal a nobleman's dark descent into necromancy...
description: When three guests are found dead under impossible circumstances at the remote Whitmore Estate, the party must unravel a web of secrets, forbidden research, and supernatural horror. This investigation-heavy adventure combines classic detective work with D&D's supernatural elements, as the characters discover that grief-stricken Lord Whitmore's attempts to resurrect his dead son have unleashed forces beyond his control. Featuring locked-room mysteries, hidden laboratories, and a climactic confrontation with the undead, this adventure emphasizes roleplay and deduction over combat while delivering genuine chills and meaningful choices.

name: The Corvid's Curse
preview: In Ravenshollow, a murder of crows speaks with voices of the dead, driving villagers to madness...
description: When grief-stricken druid Mordecai Blackfeather tears the veil between life and death, thousands of crows become conduits for the voices of the deceased. In the Gothic horror tradition, this atmospheric adventure emphasizes psychological terror over combat as the party investigates a village where corvids whisper impossible secrets and reveal truths that shatter minds. Players must unravel the mystery of the corrupted druid circle, confront their own mortality through conversations with the dead, and choose between multiple resolution paths that each carry profound moral weight. Features rich atmospheric descriptions, extensive NPC dialogue, sanity mechanics, and multiple endings ranging from redemption to divine intervention.

name: Ravenscroft
preview: Uncover the haunted legacy of the Ravenscroft family in a dark, gothic mystery where secrets whisper from the shadows...
description: In Ravenscroft: Whispers of the Forgotten, a party of brave adventurers is drawn to a fog-shrouded coastal town steeped in sorrow and superstition. At its heart looms the Ravenscroft Mansion—a decaying estate filled with arcane relics, restless spirits, and a cursed family secret buried deep beneath its foundations. As players explore its haunted halls, decipher cryptic clues, and face twisted horrors born of grief and ambition, they must unravel the truth behind the Soulshard Amulet before it falls into darker hands. This level 3 adventure blends gothic horror and magical mystery, perfect for those who love atmospheric storytelling and unraveling the secrets of the dead.

name: The Gilded Conspiracy
preview: In the golden city of Aurelius, missing persons return as perfect—but inhuman—versions of themselves...
description: A sophisticated urban adventure that plunges players into the political heart of Aurelius, a magnificent city where wealth and corruption intertwine. When the desperate begin disappearing from the lower districts only to return as eerily perfect versions of themselves, the party uncovers a conspiracy that reaches the highest levels of government. This investigation-heavy adventure features complex faction politics, moral ambiguity, and body horror as players navigate between noble houses, merchant guilds, and a sinister cult seeking to transform humanity itself. With detailed city districts, extensive NPC interactions, and multiple resolution paths, players must prevent a mass transformation that would remake every citizen into golden perfection—but at the cost of their humanity.

name: The Sundered Crown
preview: The ancient dwarven crown lies shattered, and without its unifying power, the seven great clans fracture while ancient evils stir below...
description: A deep dive into dwarven politics and culture as the party navigates the complex relationships between seven great clans in the underground kingdom of Khaz Ankor. When the legendary Crown of Mountain Kings shatters during a clan dispute, its seven sacred gems scatter across the realm, taking with them the magical unity that has held the kingdom together for millennia. Players must prove themselves worthy of each clan's trust through trials that test the core dwarven virtues: Honor, Courage, Wisdom, Industry, Loyalty, Faith, and Unity. As ancient seals weaken and forgotten enemies stir in the depths, the party races against time to restore not just a crown, but the very soul of dwarven civilization. Features rich cultural immersion, political intrigue, meaningful moral choices, and a climactic restoration ritual that brings together all seven clans.

name: The Goblin County Fair
preview: Magical chaos erupts at the annual goblin county fair when enchanted attractions run amok...
description: A delightful one-shot adventure perfect for new players or groups seeking lighthearted fun. When young goblin inventor Pipkin supercharges the county fair's magical generator with experimental pixie dust, carnival attractions come to life with chaotic results. Players must rescue fairgoers from a carousel of bucking wooden horses, navigate a funhouse maze of interdimensional mirrors, battle sentient pies in a food fight gone wrong, and prevent superpowered strongmen from accidentally destroying everything. This adventure emphasizes creative problem-solving over combat, offers multiple solutions to each challenge, and rewards heroic thinking with memorable moments. Features colorful NPCs, escalating magical mayhem, and a satisfying resolution that lets heroes enjoy the restored fair festivities.

name: The Clockwork Conspiracy
preview: In the steam-shrouded city of Gearshire, brilliant inventor Professor Steamwright has vanished and his revolutionary automaton designs appear in criminal hands...
description: A Victorian steampunk adventure that plunges players into the industrial intrigue of Gearshire, where steam-powered machines work alongside humans and brass-plated mansions tower over soot-covered tenements. When the city's greatest inventor disappears and factory 'accidents' multiply, the party uncovers a conspiracy involving forced mechanical modifications of workers, revolutionary sabotage, and a mysterious figure known as the Brass Baron who manipulates both sides for personal gain. This investigation-heavy adventure features rich steampunk atmosphere, moral complexity around industrial progress versus worker welfare, and multiple resolution paths ranging from social reform to armed revolution. Players navigate between corporate espionage and revolutionary politics while dealing with rogue automatons, steam-powered street gangs, and the ethical implications of magical technology in an industrial society.

name: The Willowbrook Incident
preview: In the quiet farming town of Willowbrook, children draw disturbing pictures and residents sleepwalk toward the old grain silo...
description: A psychological horror adventure that captures the essence of small-town terror, where the party discovers that the seemingly peaceful community of Willowbrook harbors a dark secret spanning generations. When travelers begin disappearing and children's drawings reveal disturbing patterns, the heroes uncover an ancient covenant between the town's leadership and a malevolent entity known as the Hunger. This investigation-heavy adventure emphasizes atmospheric tension over combat, building dread through gradually revealed corruption as ordinary townspeople prove to be something far more sinister. Players must navigate social interactions where trust becomes impossible, uncover a conspiracy that has consumed most of the town's population, and confront an aberrant horror that has been feeding on human sacrifice for nearly a century. Features multiple resolution paths, moral complexity around community survival versus individual conscience, and escalating supernatural encounters that culminate in a choice between containing ancient evil or destroying it entirely.

name: Pirates of the Shattered Sky
preview: Sail the endless blue skies aboard the Windchaser, seeking the legendary Celestial Compass among floating islands and storm-wracked peaks...
description: A swashbuckling high-adventure campaign that takes players into the realm of Aethermoor, where a magical catastrophe called the Skybreak has shattered the heavens and left floating islands drifting through endless blue skies. As crew members aboard Captain Zara Stormwind's sky ship Windchaser, the party embarks on a quest to find the three components of the legendary Celestial Compass—an artifact that points toward the greatest treasure within a thousand miles. Their journey leads them to a wind monastery where monks test their wisdom, a storm-wracked dragon's lair that challenges their courage, and the treasure vault of the infamous Pirate Queen Scarlett Cloudrider. Featuring aerial ship combat, exploration of wondrous floating islands, colorful NPCs with their own agendas, and multiple approaches to each challenge, this adventure emphasizes the joy of discovery and the freedom of limitless horizons. The campaign culminates in the discovery of the Heart of the Skybreak itself, offering players ultimate power and the choice of how to reshape their world.

name: Lords of the Crimson Fleet
preview: From adventurers to pirate lords—claim territory, build a fleet, and forge your own empire in the lawless Crimson Reaches...
description: A comprehensive empire-building campaign that transforms players from adventurers into pirate lords commanding their own fleet and territory. Set in the resource-rich Crimson Reaches following the death of the previous Pirate King, players must navigate complex politics, build and manage multiple ships, establish territorial control, and deal with the moral complexities of balancing piracy with leadership. This campaign features large-scale naval combat, economic management, crew development, and meaningful choices between profit and principles. Players face rival pirate captains, Royal Navy expeditions, merchant consortiums, and ancient guardians while building relationships, managing resources, and deciding what kind of leaders they want to become. The campaign emphasizes the transformation from individual heroes to responsible rulers, exploring whether power corrupts or whether good people can create better systems even within traditionally villainous frameworks.
